description: The dashboard presents all metrics in detail and is meant for finer-grained analytics.

panels.description: The state of the quality gate associated with your project. Possible values are ERROR and OK
panels.title: Quality Gate Status

panels.description:
- Lines (lines): The number of physical lines 
- Lines of code (ncloc): The number of physical lines that contain at least one character
- Comment lines (comment_lines): The number of lines containing comment
panels.title: Lines of code

panels.description: The comment lines density = comment lines / (lines of code + comment lines) * 100
panels.title: The comment lines density

panels.description: The number of classes (including nested classes, interfaces, enums, and annotations).
panels.title: The number of classes

panels.description: The number of statements.
panels.title: The number of statements

panels.description: The number of functions. Depending on the language, a function is defined as either a function, a method, or a paragraph.
panels.title: The number of functions

panels.description: The number of files.
panels.title: The number of files

panels.description: The total count of issues in all states.
panels.title: Total of Issues

panels.description: The total count of issues of the specified severity, where xxx is one of: blocker, critical, major, minor, info.
panels.title: Violations

panels.description: The total count of issues in the state.
panels.title: Issues

panels.description: The number of vulnerability issues.
panels.title: The number of vulnerability issues.

panels.description: The measure is stored in minutes in the DB. An 8-hour day is assumed when values are shown in days.
panels.title: The effort to fix all vulnerability issues

panels.description: The number of Security Hotspots
panels.title: The number of Security Hotspots

panels.description:
Security Rating (security_rating)
- A = 0 Vulnerabilities
- B = at least 1 Minor Vulnerability
- C = at least 1 Major Vulnerability
- D = at least 1 Critical Vulnerability
- E = at least 1 Blocker Vulnerability
panels.title: Security Rating

panels.description:
The security review rating is a letter grade based on the percentage of Reviewed Security Hotspots.
- A = >= 80%
- B = >= 70% and <80%
- C = >= 50% and <70%
- D = >= 30% and <50%
- E = < 30%
panels.title: Security review rating

panels.description: - Duplicated lines (duplicated_lines): The number of lines involved in duplications.
panels.title: Duplicated lines

panels.description: - Duplicated files (duplicated_files): The number of files involved in duplications.
panels.title: Duplicated files

panels.description: - Duplicated blocks (duplicated_blocks): The number of blocks involved in duplications.
panels.title: Duplicated blocks

panels.description: Duplicated lines (%) (duplicated_lines_density): duplicated_lines / (lines of code) * 100
panels.title: Duplicated Lines (%)

panels.description:
Coverage = (CT + CF + LC)/(2*B + EL)
where:
- CT = conditions that have been evaluated to 'true' at least once
- CF = conditions that have been evaluated to 'false' at least once
- LC = covered lines = linestocover - uncovered_lines
- B = total number of conditions
- EL = total number of executable lines (lines_to_cover)
panels.title: Coverage

panels.description: The number of lines of code that could be covered by unit tests (for example, blank lines or full comments lines are not considered as lines to cover).
panels.title: The number of lines that are covered by unit test

panels.description: The number of skipped tests.
panels.title: The number of skipped tests

panels.description: The total number of bug issues.
panels.title: The total number of bug issues

panels.description:
- A = 0 Bugs
- B = at least 1 Minor Bug
- C = at least 1 Major Bug
- D = at least 1 Critical Bug
- E = at least 1 Blocker Bug
panels.title: Reliability Rating

panels.description: The measure is stored in minutes in the DB. An 8-hour day is assumed when values are shown in days.
panels.title: The effort to fix all bug issues

panels.description: The total count of code smell issues.
panels.title: The total count of code smell issues

panels.description:
Formerly the SQALE rating.) The rating given to your project related to the value of your technical debt ratio. The default maintainability rating grid is:

- A=0-0.05, B=0.06-0.1, C=0.11-0.20, D=0.21-0.5, E=0.51-1
panels.title: Maintainability Rating

panels.description: A measure of effort to fix all code smells. The measure is stored in minutes in the database. An 8-hour day is assumed when values are shown in days.
panels.title: Technical Debt

panels.description: Complexity / File
panels.title: Complexity / File

panels.description: How hard it is to understand the code's control flow
panels.title: Cognitive Complexity

panels.description: Complexity refers to cyclomatic complexity, a quantitative metric used to calculate the number of paths through the code.
panels.title: Cyclomatic Complexity

title: Sonarqube - Scan dashboard
